images.summary: This image shows the South elevation of a dairy goat barn. The elevation includes metal siding and concrete foundation details. There are overhead doors measuring 10'-0" x 10'-0" and various window placements. The section callout '1/S1' indicates a reference to another sheet. The elevation provides dimensions such as 11'-0" to the top of the wall and 8'-0" to the top of the footing. The awning is noted as '36" AWNING (3/S4)'.

images.summary: This image provides a drawing index listing various sheets for the project. It includes 'ELEVATIONS' on page S1, 'FOUNDATION PLAN' on page S2, 'MAIN FLOOR PLAN' on page S3, 'ROOF PLAN' on page S4, 'BUILDING SECTIONS' on page S5, and 'DETAILS & NOTES' on page S6. This index helps in navigating the different sections of the construction documents.

images.summary: This image shows the North elevation of the dairy goat barn. It features metal siding and a concrete foundation. Overhead doors are sized at 12'-0" x 11'-6" and there is a lift door measuring 9'-0". An exhaust fan is noted with a specific placement requirement. The section callout '3/S1' references another sheet. Key dimensions include 12'-0" to the top of the wall and 8'-0" to the top of the footing.

There are high curtains measuring 136'-0" x 10'-0" and an overhead door sized at 20'-0" x 10'-6". The section callout '2/S1' indicates a reference to another sheet. The elevation provides a clear view of the building's external features.

images.summary: This image shows the East elevation of the dairy goat barn. It features metal roofing and siding, with a concrete foundation. High curtains are noted at 104'-0" x 10'-0". The elevation provides dimensions such as 11'-0" for the wall height. This view helps in understanding the structural layout and external appearance of the barn.

images.text_verbatim:
SINGLE SHEARWALL
7/16" OSB ON ONE SIDE FASTENED w/ 2 3/8" NAIL-GUN NAILS @ 4" o.c. PANEL EDGES AND 8" o.c. IN FIELD. PROVIDE BLOCKING @ 24" o.c. AND ALL PANEL EDGES. (3) PLY STUD POST EACH END OF SHEARWALL PANEL WHERE NO POST PRESENT SEE DETAIL 2/S3

DOUBLE SHEARWALL
7/16" OSB ON BOTH SIDES FASTENED w/ 2 3/8" NAIL-GUN NAILS @ 4" o.c. PANEL EDGES AND 8" o.c. IN FIELD. PROVIDE BLOCKING @ 24" o.c. AND ALL PANEL EDGES. (3) PLY STUD POST EACH END OF SHEARWALL PANEL WHERE NO POST PRESENT SEE DETAIL 2/S3
images.summary: This image contains notes for single and double shearwalls. The single shearwall uses 7/16" OSB on one side, fastened with 2 3/8" nail-gun nails at 4 inches on center along panel edges and 8 inches on center in the field. Blocking is required at 24 inches on center and at all panel edges. A three-ply stud post is needed at each end of the shearwall panel where no post is present. The double shearwall is similar but uses OSB on both sides. Both types reference detail 2/S3 for further information.

images.summary: This schedule outlines the specifications for foundation walls, baseplates, and footings. Foundation walls include W1, an 8-inch wall at 4'-4" high, and W2, a 10-inch sandwich wall at 8'-0" high, both reinforced as per details 7/S6 and 6/S6, respectively. Curb walls W3, W3b, W4, and W6 are detailed with specific heights and reinforcement requirements. Baseplates BP1 and BP2 are specified with dimensions and anchor bolt details, referencing detail 2/S6. Footings F1 and F2 are described with dimensions, concrete strength, and reinforcement details, also referencing detail 2/S6.

images.text_verbatim:

15M - VERT. MATCH CURB HEIGHT x 10" H.

SCALE: 3/4" = 1'-0"
images.summary: This detail shows a 12-inch high curb wall with options for 8-inch or 6-inch thick poured concrete, depending on owner direction. The curb is reinforced with 15M vertical bars matching the curb height and hooks at 24 inches on center, alternating directions into the thickened floor. The floor is a 6-inch concrete slab, thickened to 8 inches below the curb, with compacted granular 'A' fill beneath. Horizontal reinforcement includes two 15M bars at the top. This detail is referenced as 4/S2.

images.text_verbatim:

THIS SIDE TAPERED
6" CONCRETE FLOOR
COMPACTED GRANULAR 'A' FILL
FLOOR THICKENED TO 8" BELOW CURB (20" WIDE)
(2) 15M CONT
MANGER CURB DETAIL
SCALE: 3/4" = 1'-0"
images.summary: This manger curb detail illustrates a curb with chamfered top edges, reinforced with 15M vertical bars bent into the floor at 24 inches on center, and a continuous 10M bar at the top. The curb is tapered on one side. The floor is a 6-inch concrete slab, thickened to 8 inches below the curb, with compacted granular 'A' fill beneath. Two continuous 15M bars are included. This detail is referenced as 2/S2.

images.summary: This foundation plan provides an overall layout of the barn's foundation, including a 3200 sq.ft. manure storage pad with a 6-inch thick concrete floor. The plan includes unexcavated areas with a 6-inch concrete floor and a minimum of 4 inches of compacted granular 'A' fill over undisturbed soil. Dropped pen floor areas are noted, with edge details referenced. The floor is thickened to 8 inches below curbs, which are 20 inches wide. Foundation walls W1, W2, W3, W4, and W6 are specified with heights and types. Section callouts 2/S2 and 4/S2 provide additional detail references.

images.summary: This foundation plan shows the layout of the foundation, including unexcavated areas and concrete floors with compacted granular 'A' fill. The plan includes dropped pen floors, indicated by the note 'SEE EDGE DETAIL (TYP.)'. The foundation plan is scaled at 1/4" = 1'-0". The baseplate and footing schedules are provided, detailing the structural support elements. Section callouts such as '1/S2', '2/S2', and '3/S2' indicate where sections are cut through the plan.

images.summary: This detail shows the edge of a manure pad with specific reinforcement and concrete cover requirements. The manure pad edge detail is scaled at 3/4" = 1'-0". It includes a 2-inch cover to concrete on top and sides, with a slope away from the structure. The reinforcement consists of 4 continuous 15M bars with a minimum lap of 1'-8" at splices. The compacted granular 'A' base is specified to be at least 6 inches thick. The section callout '3/S3' indicates the detail's location on the plan.

images.summary: This detail illustrates the shearwall anchor system, showing the connection between the shearwall and the foundation. The detail is scaled at 1" = 1'-0". It includes 7/16" O.S.B. sheathing fastened with nail-gun nails, a 3-ply stud post, and a 6" x 3" x 1/4" angle with a 5/8" anchor bolt. The anchor bolts are spaced at 48 inches on center, typical. The concrete foundation wall is constructed as per the plan. The section callout '2/S3' references this detail in the plan.

images.text_verbatim:

8" CONC. FND. WALL

images.summary: This section view detail shows the construction of a wall assembly with 7/16" O.S.B. sheathing on one or two sides as per the plan. The angle is fastened to studs using 5/16" x 3" wood lags. The concrete foundation wall is 8 inches thick, with a 15M top perimeter reinforcement typical. This detail provides a cross-sectional view of the wall's structural components.

The plan is scaled at 1/4" = 1'-0" and includes structural elements such as W16 x 45 steel beams. Water bowls are indicated to be provided by others. The section callout '1/S3' references a section cut through the plan, providing additional detail on the structural layout.

images.summary: This main floor plan shows the layout of the ground floor of a barn, including goat pens, nurseries, and utility areas. The plan includes structural elements such as W18 x 45 steel beams and water bowls (by others). Framed walls are detailed with specifications for 2x6 exterior and interior walls, including metal wall cladding, housewrap, and insulation details. The plan specifies single and double shearwalls with OSB sheathing and nail-gun nails, with blocking and stud post requirements. Lintel and column schedules are provided, detailing various headers and steel beams, with references to additional details on other sheets. Section callout 2/S3 is noted for shearwall details.

images.summary: This detail shows the shearwall anchor system for the ground floor. It includes 7/16" OSB sheathing fastened with 2 3/8" nail-gun nails at 4 inches on center along panel edges and 8 inches on center in the field. Blocking is provided at 24 inches on center. The top of the wall is secured to the truss as per the roof plan. A 3-ply stud post is located at each end of the wall section. The detail includes a 6" x 3" x 1/4" angle with a 5/8" anchor bolt or equivalent epoxy anchor embedded 8 inches into concrete at each end of the shearwall. The concrete foundation wall is detailed with a 15M top perimeter. The section view provides additional dimensions and fastening details.

images.summary: This section contains notes on framed walls and schedules for lintels and columns. The framed walls include specifications for W10 2x6 exterior walls with metal cladding, housewrap, and insulation. Interior walls W11, W12, and W13 have details on OSB sheathing, stud spacing, and insulation. Single and double shearwalls are described with fastening and blocking requirements, referencing detail 2/S3. The lintel schedule lists various headers and beams, with references to additional details on sheet S6. The column schedule specifies different post types, including HSS steel posts, with references to detail 2/S6.

images.summary: This section provides detailed specifications for framed walls, including W10 2x6 exterior walls with metal cladding, housewrap, and insulation. Interior walls W11, W12, and W13 are specified with OSB sheathing, stud spacing, and insulation. Single and double shearwalls are described with fastening and blocking requirements, referencing detail 2/S3. The specifications ensure structural integrity and compliance with client requirements, including AG Tuff liner and insulation details.

images.text_verbatim:
2 AWNING DETAIL
SCALE: 3/4" = 1'-0"
METAL TRACK CENTRED OVER PURLIN SPLICE
RIDGE AND EAVE PURLINS (SEE PLAN FOR NUMBER OF ROWS)

Ridge and eave purlins are referenced, with splice locations centered on trusses. The detail specifies the use of N10HDG nails on each side of each splice, ensuring secure attachment. The metal track is installed per plan, providing structural support and alignment for the roof system. This detail ensures proper installation and alignment of roof components, contributing to the overall structural integrity of the barn.

images.summary: This detail illustrates the awning connection at the roof level. The awning is constructed with 29 GA. roofing steel over 1x4 strapping and 1/2" plywood sheathing. The 2x8 ledger is secured with four #12 x4" screws to each stud, and the rafters are fastened to the top of the ledger using a Simpson Strong-Tie RR Connector. The rafters are 2x6 spaced at 24 inches on center. A 2x4 ledger is secured with two 3 1/2" Ardox screws to each stud. The detail includes a hanger and specifies a 3'-0" dimension for the awning projection. The scale of the drawing is 3/4" = 1'-0".

ROOF PLAN NOTES:
PROVIDE ATTIC FIRE STOPS AS SHOWN. 7/16" OSB SECURED TO TRUSS OR 2x3 FRAMING AS REQUIRED.
ALL JOINTS SHALL HAVE CONTINUOUS SUPPORT.
NO DIMENSION IN COMPARTMENT SHALL EXCEED 98'-4".
FIRE STOP NOT TO INTERFERE ROOF VENTILATION.
PROVIDE ATTIC HATCHES INTO EACH ATTIC PORTION OR PROVIDE 1 ATTIC HATCH AND DOOR IN THE FIRESTOPS.
TRUSSES SHALL BEAR DIRECTLY TO POST
CONFIRM ALL DIMENSIONS BEFORE ORDERING TRUSSES.

OVERHANGS AS DIMENSIONED
images.summary: This image contains the legend and roof plan notes for the roof plan. The legend identifies symbols for bearing walls, fire stops, pre-engineered trusses, and continuous purlins, with a reference to detail 3/S4. The roof plan notes specify the provision of attic fire stops using 7/16" OSB secured to trusses or 2x3 framing, ensuring continuous support for all joints. No compartment dimension should exceed 98'-4", and fire stops must not interfere with roof ventilation. Attic hatches are required in each attic portion, and trusses must bear directly to posts. All dimensions must be confirmed before ordering trusses, and 'X' bracing of truss laterals is required as per manufacturer shop drawings, with reference to detail 1/S6. Overhangs are to be constructed as dimensioned.

MILKING PARLOUR DETAIL
SCALE: 3/4" = 1'-0"
images.summary: This detail shows a section through the milking parlour, highlighting the concrete floor and wall construction. The 6" concrete floor is made with 32 MPa concrete, reinforced with three 15M continuous rebars on both sides. Verticals are bent to tie into the floor. The sill plate is set on a 1/4" sill gasket with 1/2" anchor bolts spaced at 48 inches on center. The 6" thick suspended slab is poured with 32 MPa concrete, reinforced with 15M rebar at 12 inches on center each way. A 1 1/2" concrete cover is provided from the bottom of the slab to the first layer of rebar. The 6" poured concrete wall is reinforced with three 15M horizontal rebars at 16 inches on center and 15M vertical rebars at 16 inches on center, bent 12 inches into the footing and top. The section also includes granular fill backfill and various dimensions, such as 2'-6", 10", 3'-6", and others. The scale is 3/4" = 1'-0".

24" X 24" X 15M HOOKS @ 24" O.C.

MILK PUMP PIT DETAIL
SCALE: 3/4" = 1'-0"
images.summary: This detail illustrates the construction of a milk pump pit. The pit features an 8-inch concrete wall made of 32 MPa concrete, reinforced with 15M horizontal rebar spaced at 16 inches on center and 15M vertical rebar with 12-inch hooks into the footing at 16 inches on center. The wall includes a tunnel opening, with additional reinforcement of two 15M horizontal bars above the opening and two 15M vertical bars beside it. The floor is thickened to 8 inches, and the footing/pit floor is constructed with 32 MPa poured concrete, reinforced with 15M continuous rebar at 18 inches on center, designed to bear on native soil with a 3000 psf bearing capacity. Additional details include 15M x 30-inch long bars doweled into the foundation wall with adhesive, providing structural integrity.

images.summary: This detail shows the construction of an 8-inch foundation wall. The wall is reinforced with two 15M horizontal bars at the top and 15M vertical bars spaced at 48 inches on center. The foundation includes an 8-inch thick by 24-inch footing made of 20 MPA concrete, with two runs of 15M rebar embedded into undisturbed soil. A sill plate is installed on a 1/4-inch sill gasket with 1/2-inch anchor bolts at 48 inches on center. The detail also specifies compacted granular 'A' fill and a 25 MPA poured concrete floor. The grade is sloped away from the building, and backfill is done with parent material.

images.summary: This detail illustrates the connection between a steel beam and a stud post. The steel beam is secured with two plates using 1/2" bolts at 24" centers, with staggered sides of the flange to match the wall top plate or beam width as required by truss manufacturers. A pre-engineered truss is supported by truss clips as per the plan. The detail includes a 3/8" endplate with 1/2" diameter A325 bolts through the studs, marked as typical with a 1/4" dimension. A double top plate is secured to the studs with sheathing per plan. The opening is framed down to the desired door height, sheathed with plywood. The number of bolts varies by beam size, with W24 beams requiring 12 bolts, W21 beams 10, and so on. The studs are specified to bear and extend full length per the plan, with a concrete foundation wall at the bottom of the door. The stud post is anchored to the foundation as detailed in 2/S3.

images.summary: This detail shows a sandwich foundation wall section with a 10" concrete wall composed of 25 MPa poured concrete and 2" x 48" rigid insulation. The wall includes 10M horizontal rebar on each side at 16" on center and 10M vertical rebar at 24" on center, with 1 1/2" concrete coverage for all reinforcing bars. The insulation is kept 24" back from the face of wall openings unless noted otherwise. The foundation includes a 24" wide by 8" thick footing made of 20 MPa concrete with two runs of 15M rebar on undisturbed soil. Dowel options include 15M x 24" dowels at 24" on center into the footing with a minimum 6" embedment or two 10M x 24" dowels. The section dimensions are 6'-0" for the wall height and 8'-0" for the total height including the footing.

TRUSS LATERAL X BRACE DETAIL
SCALE: 3/16" = 1'-0"
images.summary: This detail illustrates the truss lateral X brace system used for roof support. The system includes 2x4 diagonal X braces on the opposite side of the truss at endwalls and other specified locations. These braces are anchored with two 3 1/2" nails at each truss. Additionally, 2x4 struts, each 5'-0" long, are placed at the top and bottom with two 3 1/2" nails at each truss web member. The diagonal braces are anchored to the lateral with four 3 1/2" nails at the intersection of the truss web and truss lateral. The truss top chord, web member, and bottom chord are clearly labeled. The lateral braces must be butted at all splice locations, ensuring tight and centered joints on the truss web. The diagonal braces must extend completely from the top chord to the bottom chord of the truss, with a maximum spacing of 48'-0" as specified by the brace designer.

STEEL BEAM TO STEEL COLUMN DETAILS
SCALE: 1/2" = 1'-0"
images.summary: This detail shows the connection between steel beams and steel columns. The beams are supported by 3/8" web stiffeners on each side of the web directly above the column for through beams. Double top plates are bolted to the steel beam with 1/2" diameter bolts at 24" on center, staggered. The connection uses 3/4" A325 bolts to connect beams, with the number of bolts varying by beam size. The steel beam is per plan, with two 3/4" A325 bolts and an 8" x 6 1/2"- 3/4" top plate. The HSS steel column is per plan, with a 1/2" x beam width x 12" top plate complete with four 3/4" A325 bolts through the plate into the beam flange. Base plates BP1 and BP2 are specified, with BP1 having 1/2" anchor bolts (typical of 4) and a 3/4" thick galvanized base plate, while BP2 has a 6" x 12" x 3/4" base plate with two 3/4" x 8" long anchor bolts. The floor and compacted granular fill are per plan, with 15M reinforcement in each direction as per the footing schedule.

ANCHOR BOLT DETAIL
images.summary: This detail illustrates an anchor bolt assembly. The anchor bolt is specified as 1/2 inch in diameter and is welded to a U-hook bar. The spacing for this assembly is 4 feet on center, as indicated by the note '1/2" ANCHOR BOLT WELDED TO U-HOOK BAR @ 4'-0" o.c.'. The drawing provides dimensions for the assembly, including a width of 10 inches and a height of 4 1/2 inches, with an additional dimension of 1 1/2 inches for a specific component. The detail is labeled as 'ANCHOR BOLT DETAIL', emphasizing its focus on the connection and support provided by the anchor bolt and U-hook bar system.
